titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ الْأَئِمَّةَ ( عليهم السلام ) يَعْلَمُونَ جَمِيعَ الْعُلُومِ الَّتِي خَرَجَتْ إِلَى الْمَلَائِكَةِ وَ الْأَنْبِيَاءِ وَ الرُّسُلِ ( عليهم السلام )
titles.en: Chapter 44 – The Imams<sup>asws</sup> are knowing the entirety of the knowledges which came out to the Angels, and the Prophets<sup>as</sup> and the Rasools<sup>as</sup>

titles.ar: بَابُ أَنَّ الْأَئِمَّةَ ( عليهم السلام ) يَعْلَمُونَ جَمِيعَ الْعُلُومِ الَّتِي خَرَجَتْ إِلَى الْمَلَائِكَةِ وَ الْأَنْبِيَاءِ وَ الرُّسُلِ ( عليهم السلام )
titles.en: Chapter 44 – The Imams<sup>asws</sup> are knowing the entirety of the knowledges which came out to the Angels, and the Prophets<sup>as</sup> and the Rasools<sup>as</sup>

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ الْحَسَنِ بْنِ شَمُّونٍ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الرَّحْمَنِ عَنْ عَبْدِ اللَّهِ بْنِ الْقَاسِمِ عَنْ سَمَاعَةَ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ تَبَارَكَ وَ تَعَالَى عِلْمَيْنِ عِلْماً أَظْهَرَ عَلَيْهِ مَلَائِكَتَهُ وَ أَنْبِيَاءَهُ وَ رُسُلَهُ فَمَا أَظْهَرَ عَلَيْهِ مَلَائِكَتَهُ وَ رُسُلَهُ وَ أَنْبِيَاءَهُ فَقَدْ عَلِمْنَاهُ وَ عِلْماً اسْتَأْثَرَ بِهِ فَإِذَا بَدَا لِلَّهِ فِي شَيْ‏ءٍ مِنْهُ أَعْلَمَنَا ذَلِكَ وَ عَرَضَ عَلَى الْأَئِمَّةِ الَّذِينَ كَانُوا مِنْ قَبْلِنَا . عَلِيُّ بْنُ مُحَمَّدٍ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ الْحَسَنِ عَنْ سَهْلِ بْنِ زِيَادٍ عَنْ مُوسَى بْنِ الْقَاسِمِ وَ مُحَمَّدُ بْنُ يَحْيَى عَنِ الْعَمْرَكِيِّ بْنِ عَلِيٍّ جَمِيعاً عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ عَنْ أَخِيهِ مُوسَى بْنِ جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) مِثْلَهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Muhammad and Muhammad Bin Al Hassan, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Muhammad Bin Al Hassan Bin Shamoun, from Abdullah Bin Abdul Rahman, from Abdullah Bin Al Qasim, from Sama’at, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> having said: ‘For Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Blessed and High there are two (types of) Knowledges – a Knowledge He<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Manifested upon the Angels and His<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Prophets<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup> and His<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Rasools<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup>. So whatever was Manifested upon His<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Angels, and His<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Rasools<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup>, and His<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Prophets<sup style="font-weight: normal">as</sup>, we<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> know it; and a Knowledge He<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> is exclusive with it. So whenever Allah<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> begins regarding something from it, He<sup style="font-weight: normal">azwj</sup> Teaches us<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> that and it is displayed upon the Imams<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup> who were before us<sup style="font-weight: normal">asws</sup>’. 
Ali Bin Muhammad and Muhammad Bin Al Hassan, from Sahl Bin Ziyad, from Musa Bin Al Qasim and Muhammad Bin Yahya, from Al Amraky Bin Ali, altogether, 
(It has been narrated) from Ali son of Ja’far<sup>asws</sup>, from his brother<sup>asws</sup> Musa<sup>asws</sup> Bin Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> – similar to it.

verses.text: عِدَّةٌ مِنْ أَصْحَابِنَا عَنْ أَحْمَدَ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنِ الْحُسَيْنِ بْنِ سَعِيدٍ عَنِ الْقَاسِمِ بْنِ مُحَمَّدٍ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ أَبِي حَمْزَةَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي عَبْدِ اللَّهِ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عِلْمَيْنِ عِلْماً عِنْدَهُ لَمْ يُطْلِعْ عَلَيْهِ أَحَداً مِنْ خَلْقِهِ وَ عِلْماً نَبَذَهُ إِلَى مَلَائِكَتِهِ وَ رُسُلِهِ فَمَا نَبَذَهُ إِلَى مَلَائِكَتِهِ وَ رُسُلِهِ فَقَدِ انْتَهَى إِلَيْنَا .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
A number of our companions, from Ahmad Bin Muhammad, from Al Husayn Bin Saeed, from Al Qasim Bin Muhammad, from Ali Bin Abu Hamza, from Abu Baseer, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Abdullah<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘For Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic there are two (types of) Knowledges. There is a Knowledge with Him<sup>azwj</sup> which He<sup>azwj</sup> has not Notified upon anyone from His<sup>azwj</sup> creatures with it. And there is a Knowledge which He<sup>saww</sup> Cast to His<sup>azwj</sup> Angels, and His<sup>azwj</sup> Rasools<sup>as</sup>. So whatever He<sup>azwj</sup> Cast to His<sup>azwj</sup> Angels and His<sup>azwj</sup> Rasools<sup>as</sup>, so it has ended up to us<sup>asws</sup>’.

verses.text: عَلِيُّ بْنُ إِبْرَاهِيمَ عَنْ صَالِحِ بْنِ السِّنْدِيِّ عَنْ جَعْفَرِ بْنِ بَشِيرٍ عَنْ ضُرَيْسٍ قَالَ سَمِعْتُ أَبَا جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) يَقُولُ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عِلْمَيْنِ عِلْمٌ مَبْذُولٌ وَ عِلْمٌ مَكْفُوفٌ فَأَمَّا الْمَبْذُولُ فَإِنَّهُ لَيْسَ مِنْ شَيْ‏ءٍ تَعْلَمُهُ الْمَلَائِكَةُ وَ الرُّسُلُ إِلَّا نَحْنُ نَعْلَمُهُ وَ أَمَّا الْمَكْفُوفُ فَهُوَ الَّذِي عِنْدَ اللَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ فِي أُمِّ الْكِتَابِ إِذَا خَرَجَ نَفَذَ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Ali Bin Ibrahim, from Salih Bin Al Sindy, from Ja’far Bin Bashir, from Zureys who said, 
‘I heard Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> saying: ‘For Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic there are (two types of) Knowledges – A Knowledge Granted and a Knowledge Withheld. So as for the Withheld, so there isn’t anything which He<sup>azwj</sup> Taught to the Angels and the Rasools<sup>as</sup> except that we<sup>asws</sup> know it; and as for the Withheld, so it that which is in the Presence of Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic in the Mother of the Book. Whenever it comes out, it is Granted’.

verses.text: أَبُو عَلِيٍّ الْأَشْعَرِيُّ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ عَبْدِ الْجَبَّارِ عَنْ مُحَمَّدِ بْنِ إِسْمَاعِيلَ عَنْ عَلِيِّ بْنِ النُّعْمَانِ عَنْ سُوَيْدٍ الْقَلَّاءِ عَنْ أَبِي أَيُّوبَ عَنْ أَبِي بَصِيرٍ عَنْ أَبِي جَعْفَرٍ ( عليه السلام ) قَالَ إِنَّ لِلَّهِ عَزَّ وَ جَلَّ عِلْمَيْنِ عِلْمٌ لَا يَعْلَمُهُ إِلَّا هُوَ وَ عِلْمٌ عَلَّمَهُ مَلَائِكَتَهُ وَ رُسُلَهُ فَمَا عَلَّمَهُ مَلَائِكَتَهُ وَ رُسُلَهُ ( عليهم السلام ) فَنَحْنُ نَعْلَمُهُ .

translations.name: hubeali
translations.text:
Abu Ali Al Ashary, from Muhammad Bin Abdul Jabbar, from Muhammad Bin Ismail, from Ali Bin Al Nu’man, from Suweyd Al Qalla’a, from Abu Ayoub, from Abu Baseer, 
(It has been narrated) from Abu Ja’far<sup>asws</sup> having said: ‘For Allah<sup>azwj</sup> Mighty and Majestic there are two (types of) Knowledges – a Knowledge which no one knows except Him<sup>azwj</sup>, and a Knowledge which He<sup>azwj</sup> Taught His<sup>azwj</sup> Angels, and His<sup>azwj</sup> Rasools<sup>as</sup>. So whatever He<sup>azwj</sup> Taught His<sup>azwj</sup> Angels and His<sup>azwj</sup> Rasools<sup>as</sup>, so we<sup>asws</sup> know it’.
